page.title: 01Glatton and Hunts Wolds
page.content: The undulating hills of the Huntingdonshire Wolds fall to the fenland edge on the east of block. There two settlemnts are sited. Denton is a hamlet with a dozen houses and farms. Its fields contain the ponds and grassed foundations of habitations long disappeared. Its church is a roofless shell. Glatton is a village of 200 people. Its houses are a mix of ancient buildings, including dozen renovted timbered thatched cottages, Victorian buildings and individuals modern houses. New houses here tend to be large and costly. Conquently there are few young families and no school. St Nicholas' 15th centurey church is regular used. Village social life centres on the village hall. The village is surrounded by the land of five large farms with buildings on the edges of the village. There are
